result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven Michael Watts was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay as required by Clerk of Courts.
Pay as required by Clerk of Courts.
Programming as deemed appropriate by DOC

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven Michael Watts

records.addlTxt:
9:45 AM Prosecuting attorney Chad C La Lor in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Steven Michael Watts in court.  Attorney Fredric B. Anderson in court for Steven Michael Watts. 
Att Anderson- plea to charge. 30 days jail imposed and stayed in favor of 1 year probation. Conditions of 2 days jail, 2 days credit. Programming as per DOC. $25 fine plus costs.
State agrees
Defendant pleads guilty to charge
Court questions defendant, finds plea is voluntary. Judgment entered on charge. 
Defendant makes statement
Court-30 days jail imposed and stayed in favor of 1 year probation. Conditions of 2 days jail, 2 days credit. Programming as per DOC. $25 fine plus costs.

records.addlTxt: 09:43 AM Defendant Steven Michael Watts in court.  Chad C La Lor appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews at last appearance defendant was going to obtain counsel. Defendant states he got busy the last 2 weeks and didn't have time. Defendant states he does not qualify for Public Defender. Court reviews with defendant options of obtaining counsel. Court sets status conference. Court instructs defendant to Public Defenders Office after Court.  Status conference scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.

09:35 AM Defendant Steven Michael Watts in court.  Chad C La Lor appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court reviews attorney rights. 
Defendant wants attorney
Court explains court appointed attorney rights, sets new date
  Status conference scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.
No violent or abusive contact with Hope Watts,   No use or possession of alcohol, no dangerous weapons

03:16 PM Defendant Steven Michael Watts in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  Defendant Steven Michael Watts in custody.  Chad C La Lor appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant's address confirmed. Attorney Hoffman acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading, and pleads not guilty. Court accepts the plea of Not guilty. 
  States request on bail: $750 signature bond with conditions of no violent or abusive contact with Hope Watts, no alcohol use; state notes two failures to appear in State of Minnestoa. Attorney Hoffman states NO objections to States request.
Court orders $750 signature bond with conditions of no violent or abusive contact with Hope Watts. No possession or use of alcohol or dangerous weapons.
  Status conference scheduled for February 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.
